Articles.Content: has this forum died down considerably in the past two weeks? i feel like there isn\'t as much new stuff being added or excitement anymore. maybe i\'m just crazy.
Wait a few weeks, then there will be some more major excitement just before docking is implemented. Also, the C7 parts.

A lot of people are getting tired of munshots, there\'s activity on the challenges board though (I gave people a race, may have been too hard for most though)

I guess losing the experimentals and helping bughunt has put a few off as well, the development board is very quiet, bug reports are rare now we have a volunteer team with their own private area and you\'ll notice it doesn\'t say 'suggestions' there anymore, I guess people don\'t feel as inclined to speak up if they think it won\'t do any good.

I know I have found a few bugs in 0.14.4 but I have no idea if they are already known or not.

Add-on development is still strong, but I guess you need to be able to make something to really be a part of it, I don\'t have the imagination for that though

Edit: Yeah I almost forgot, a lot of younger players got butthurt when the moderators were forced to step in a few times, it used to feel like everyone could get involved with the game but now it feels a bit more distant.
Check this out http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=10662.0 that will get you maybe another week on your hands >=D
It could also have died down because many of the active members are young, and various schools have spring break weeks throughout the month of April.

It could also have died down because many of the active members are young, and various schools have spring break weeks throughout the month of April.

[Facepalm] Of course, that didn\'t even cross my mind, I\'m stuck here waiting for the next job in a few weeks and it\'s raining or I\'d be out on my bike.
